page.title: 09ST.PETER'S CHURCH,INKBERROW.
page.content: The church is called Saint Peter's and it has a clock tower with a flag pole.Sometimes the flag is up and you can see it from the school.In the tower there are some bells and they are rung by pulling ropes.The church is built of stone from the old quarry down Stonepits Lane.It stands on a hill.The east wall is 3 feet deep.There was a church in the time of the Domesday book but none of that remains.The oldest part was built in the 13th century.We go to church to decorate the font for the Harvest Festival.We cut down some thorns and our scissors broke just as we did the last bit.A lot of people go to the services.The Brownies,Guides,Cubs and Scouts often parade their colours.A new vicar was inducted a few weeks ago and there was a special service.
